intro: Rubus alumnus, commonly known as the alumnus raspberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
